intro: Tanarius denticulatus, commonly known as the toothed tanarius, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five lobes and a distinctive, tooth-like appearance on its leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
